DOC.brief_summary: The study assess safety ability orally inhaled medicine [ i.e. , Glycopyrrolate Inhalation Solution = GIS ] improve airflow lung deliver use eFlow nebulizer 42 patient Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD ) . Each patient randomly receive several , single dos GIS , placebo , separate approximately 1 2 week . After dose give , lung airflow measure 24 hour blood collect measure much GIS bloodstream . The study conduct find once-a- day GIS dose produce high improvement lung airflow use eFlow nebulizer .
DOC.brief_title: Assessment Safety Ability Once-a-day Dose Orally Inhaled Medicine i.e. , Glycopyrrolate Inhalation Solution = GIS Improve Airflow Lungs When Delivered Using eFlow Nebulizer Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD )
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male female patient age 40 75 year , inclusive 2 . A clinical diagnosis COPD accord GOLD guideline 3 . Current smoker exsmokers least 10 packyear smoke history ( e.g. , least 1 pack/day 10 4 . Postbronchodilator FEV1 3070 % predict normal Screening Visit 5 . Postbronchodilator FEV1/FVC ratio < 0.70 Screening Visit 6 . Improvement FEV1 > 12 % 150 mL follow inhalation ipratropium bromide Screening Visit 7 . Ability perform reproducible spirometry accord ATS/ERS guideline 8 . Willing stay study site approximately 30 hour treatment visit 9 . Willing able provide write informed consent 1 . Females pregnant lactate Screening Visit , childbearing potential use one follow acceptable mean birth control throughout study : Abstinence Postmenopausal least two year Surgically sterile ( i.e. , tubal ligation , hysterectomy ) Oral contraceptive ( take least one month prior Screening Visit ) Approved implantable injectable contraceptive ( e.g. , Norplant® , DepoProvera® equivalent ) Barrier method ( e.g. , condom spermicide ) Intrauterine device ( i.e. , IUD ) Vasectomy male partner Nonheterosexual life style 2 . Current evidence recent history clinically significant disease ( COPD ) abnormality opinion Investigator would put subject risk would compromise quality study data ; include limit cardiovascular disease , myocardial infarction , cardiac failure , uncontrolled hypertension , lifethreatening arrhythmia , uncontrolled diabetes , neurologic neuromuscular disease , liver disease , gastrointestinal disease electrolyte abnormalities 3 . Recent history hospitalization due exacerbation airway disease within 3 month need increase treatment COPD within 6 week prior Screening Visit 4 . Primary diagnosis asthma 5 . Prior lung volume reduction surgery history chest/lung irradiation 6 . Regular use daily oxygen therapy 7 . Use systemic ( eg , intramuscular intravenous ) steroid within 3 month prior Screening Visit 8 . Respiratory tract infection within 6 week prior Screening Visit 9 . History tuberculosis , bronchiectasis non specific pulmonary disease 10 . History urinary retention bladder neck obstruction type symptom 11 . History narrowangle glaucoma 12 . Clinically significant abnormal ECG 13 . Positive Hepatitis B surface antigen positive Hepatitis C antibody 14 . Positive screen test HIV antibodies 15 . Current recent history ( previous 12 month ) excessive use abuse alcohol 16 . Current evidence history abuse legal drug use illegal drug substance 17 . Donation 450 mL blood within 8 week Screening Visit 18 . History hypersensitivity intolerance aerosol medication 19 . Participation another investigational drug study receive within 30 day prior Screening Visit
